In order to preserve his political standing, Haremhab methodically set about destroying any evidence of his prior affiliation with the Atonist move- ment and involvement with the Cloister Melchizedek Keepers of the Blue Flame. Haremhab reigned as Pharaoh from 1324 BC until his death in 1309 BC, appointing Rameses I as his successor. Following the death of Aya in 1324 BC, the Melchizedek Cloister Keepers of the Blue Flame became scat- tered throughout Egypt, being considered criminals of the state for their prior affiliation with Akhenaton.
